sentence.Network_en: She pulled herself unsteadily from the bed to the dresser.
sentence.Network_cn: 她颤巍巍地由床边挪到梳妆台前。

sentence.Network_en: Then he rolled over and raised himself unsteadily on hands and knees.
sentence.Network_cn: 接着他翻过身去,双手双膝着地,摇摇晃晃地要想站起来.

sentence.Network_en: Scarlett rose unsteadily and put a hand on Dilcey's arm.
sentence.Network_cn: 思嘉摇摇晃晃地站起来,把手放在迪尔茜的肩膀上.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(U2) ... unstatesmanlike 无政治家风度的 unsteadily 不安定地 unsteadiness 不稳定.

大学英语精读3双语版  -... ... Poise vt. 使平衡 Unsteadily ad. 不稳定地，摇摆地 Unsteady a. 不安定的，反复无常的.
2007年十月联考英... ... unnecessarily ad. 不必要地 unsteadily ad. 不安定地,不稳定地,摇摆地 unwell a. 不舒服的,身体不好的.

list.abs: 歪的英文翻译，歪用英... ... 东倒西歪 walk unsteadily 他身体特别虚弱，总是病歪歪的。 He is very weak,and is chronically ill.

entry.tran: 脚步不稳的；身体摇晃的
entry.def: If you are unsteady, you have difficulty doing something, for example walking, because you cannot completely control your legs or your body.

example.ex: The boy was very unsteady and had staggered around when he got up...
example.tran: 男孩站立不稳，并且起身后四下走动时步子踉跄。

example.ex: He poured coffee into the mugs, and with an unsteady hand, held one of them out to David.
example.tran: 他把咖啡倒进杯里，然后一只手颤巍巍地端了一杯给戴维。

entry.tran: 不稳定的；不可靠的；无法捉摸的；变幻无常的
entry.def: If you describe something as unsteady, you mean that it is not regular or stable, but unreliable or unpredictable.

example.ex: His voice was unsteady and only just audible...
example.tran: 他的声音发颤，而且小得只刚刚能听见。

example.ex: She knew first-hand the impact an unsteady parent could have on a sensitive young girl.
example.tran: 她有亲身体验，知道情绪变化无常的家长对一个敏感的小女孩会产生什么影响。

entry.tran: 不牢固的；不稳固的；不结实的
entry.def: Unsteady objects are not held, fixed, or balanced securely.

example.tran: 一件稍微有些不结实的家具

sentences.sentence: "The wounded soldier was swinging unsteadily on his legs"
